1.t: The desire to have more of the worldly gains have pre-occupied you so much (that you have neglected remembring God),

2.t: until you come to the graves.

4.t: You shall cetainly know (about the consequences of your deeds).

5.t: You will certainly have the knowledge of your deeds beyond all doubt.

7.t: and you will see it with your own eyes.

8.t: Then, on that day, you will be questioned about the bounties (of God).
